thread.title: LeBron James likely to play Monday at Ohio State, sit Tuesday in Cleveland
thread.title_full: LeBron James likely to play Monday at Ohio State, sit Tuesday in Cleveland | cleveland.com

author: Joe Vardon, Northeast Ohio Media Group
title: LeBron James likely to play Monday at Ohio State, sit Tuesday in Cleveland
text:
INDEPENDENCE, Ohio â€“ For the second straight week, the Cavaliers will play preseason games on consecutive nights, and LeBron James figures to play in one but not both.
The Cavs play Memphis on Monday night at Ohio State's Value City Arena, and on Tuesday hosts Milwaukee at The Q in their first preseason game in Cleveland this year.
James, who has a noted affinity for Ohio State and a wish to play the preseason games scheduled in non-NBA cities, said "I know for sure I'll be active Monday in Columbus and then we'll figure out Tuesday after that."
James said he would talk to Cavs coach David Blatt about playing Tuesday. When asked about his plans by reporters, Blatt said James would "probably play...one of the two."
So between James' declaration to play in Columbus and Blatt's apparent wishes to sit James in one of the next two games, it looks like Cleveland's ticket holders will be out of luck Tuesday.
Fear not, northeast Ohio. In addition to those 41 home games at The Q, the Cavs will play another preseason game there Thursday against Indiana. The odds are good James will suit up for that game.
James collected eight points, seven rebounds, five assists and shot 3-of-13 in 22 minutes against Atlanta in Cleveland's preseason-opening loss to Atlanta in Cincinnati on Wednesday. James didn't play in Philadelphia against the Sixers the following night.
